snippet: Educators worry that new standards in January will make it harder for young adults to pass the high school equivalency exam.
abstract: High school equivalency exams taken by people who dropped out of school and immigrants seeking a foothold in the American education system are about to get harder and potentially more expensive, causing concern that fewer will take and pass the exams; instructors and officials at adult education centers worry that increasing complexity could demoralize a population that already struggles to pass the current test, commonly known as the GED.
lead_paragraph: Educators worry that new standards in January will make it harder for young adults to pass the high school equivalency exam.

headline.main: Raising the G.E.D. Bar Stirs Concern for Students
headline.print_headline: Raising the G.E.D. Bar Stirs Concern for Students
